de.polygonal.ds.HashMap

type
class
implements
Collection<K>
A hash map. Each key can only map one value.

Constructor

new(?weak : Bool)
parameters
weak If true, weak keys are used - a key/value pair is lost when no other object besides this hash map holds a reference to the key. Default is false.

Instance Methods

clear() : Void

Removes all key/value pairs from this hash map.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : K -> K) : Collection<K>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: key is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this hash map.
If assign is true the copier argument is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false, and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function. For duplicating keys and values, use the setAll() method instead.
Example: 
	  class Key implements Cloneable {...}
	  class Val implements Cloneable {...}
	  ...
	  var a:HashMap<Key, Val> = new HashMap<Key, Val>();
	  var b:HashMap<Key, Val> = new HashMap<Key, Val>();
	  a.setAll(b, false, false);

contains(x : K) : Bool

Returns true if this hash map contains the key x.

get(key : K) : V

Returns the value that is mapped to key or null if the value does not exist.

has(key : K) : Bool

Returns true if key maps a value.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this hash map is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<K>

Iterates over all keys. The key can then be used to query the value.
Example: 
	  var hm = new HashMap<String, String>();
	  for (key in hm)
	  {
	    var value = hm.get(key);
	  }

remap(key : K, val : V) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key does not exist (if debug flag is set).
Remaps val to key.

remove(key : K) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key does not exist (if debug flag is set).
Unmaps key.

removeIfExists(key : K) : Bool

returns
True if the key was removed.
Unmaps key only if key is mapped to a value.

set(key : K, val : V) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key already exists (if debug flag is set).
Maps val to key.

setAll(x : HashMap<KV>, keyAssign : Bool, valAssign : Bool, ?keyCopier : K -> K, ?valCopier : V -> V) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null (if debug flag is set).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key or value is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Adds all key/value pairs in x to this hash map. If keyAssign is true the keyCopier argument is ignored and primitive keys are copied by value whereas object keys are copied by reference. If keyAssign is false, and keyCopier is null, the method assumes that all keys implement the Cloneable interface. In this case key.clone() is used for duplicating keys. Otherwise the method uses the keyCopier function. The same applies to valAssign and valCopier.

setIfAbsent(key : K, val : V) : Bool

returns
True if val was mapped to key, otherwise false.
Maps val to key only if key is not mapped to a value yet.

size() : Int

The total number of key/value pairs.

toArray(?output : Array<K>) : Array<K>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array in a random order. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var hm = new de.polygonal.ds.HashMap<String, String>();
	  hm.set("key1", "val1");
	  hm.set("key2", "val2");
	  trace(hm); //output:

	  {HashMap, #keys: 2}
	  |<
	    key1 -> val1
	    key2 -> val2
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<K>) : Vector<K>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector in a random order. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.

valuesToArray(?output : Array<V>) : Array<V>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Returns an unordered array containing all of the values in this hash map.

valuesToVector(?output : Vector<V>) : Vector<V>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Returns an unordered vector containing all of the values in this hash map.
